results.title: From egg to newt (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Life cycle of the Common Newt showing the various stages in growth from the egg to a tadpole, to the young newt with gills and legs to finally the mature newt.

results.title: From Doric to Gothic
results.creator_credit: Andre Gillet, Marcel De Hubsch and Brandon Films
results.brief_description: This film reviews the development of architectural forms from the basic column and lintel construction of Greek temples, through the Roman basilica style and Romanesque churches to the groining and buttressing of Gothic cathedrals. The importance of development of arch and the later lightening of structural appearance is pointed out. The film makes use of animation, plans, scale models and actual scenes of buildings and exteriors, including some French cathedrals.

results.title: From creeping to walking
results.creator_credit: Arnold Gesell, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Based on the work of Dr Arnold Gesell at the Yale Clinic of Child Development. Analyses mechanics of locomotion and the stages by which the infant gradually attains an upright, walking posture. Points out various stages where natural, unassisted infant action makes for best progress. Illustrates how attained abilities are related and how some are normal outgrowths of others.

results.title: From 5 to 7.30
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Read and American Temperance Society
results.brief_description: Shows the effect that drinking parents can have on their children. Joe is deeply disturbed when one of his schoolmates, because of his drinking, is involved in a motor car accident. His conviction is strengthened because he see the results of social drinking and “the cocktail hour” in his own home, and in that of his girl-friend. He seeks advice from his coach at school, and attends a lecture by Dr Andrew C. Ivy, which results in his decision to “leave it alone”.

results.title: The Frog's world
results.brief_description: Life cycle and habits of the different species of frogs and toads which live in the Japanese rice fields; how to catch them and care for them in an aquarium. The large number of eggs and tadpoles appearing each year is soon reduced by predators such as the newt, drgaon fly larvae and the water mantis. Titles and credits in Japanese. English commentary.

results.title: A Frog's life
results.brief_description: After collecting frog spawn from a river and putting it into a tank, young children observe the hatching of the spawn and the development of the tadpoles into frogs. Close-up photography is used in recording the gradual change in the frog’s development.

results.title: The Friendly hospital
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and John and Esta Handfield Productions
results.brief_description: The Austin Hospital, Heidelberg, Victoria. Details services provides by this large, modern hospital employing in addition to medical staff an army of engineers, gardeners, painters, kitchen, laundry and office staff and business experts. The hospital has a nursing training course, modern nurses home with many amenities, library, physiotherapy and occupational therapy departments and large children’s block.

results.title: A Friendly game
results.brief_description: A study and interpretation of the racist and capitalist philosophies. Two men, one white and one black, engage in a chess game, the stakes being $100 if the white man wins and the white man’s expensive chess set if he loses. At first the white man thinks the whole bet is silly since he appears to be winning. But, as the tables turn he becomes more and more upset until he loses and is unwilling to give up his chess set.

results.title: A Friend at the door
results.creator_credit: Leslie McFarlane, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a story of how rural social workers in British Columbia cover a large and rugged province, and of the ways in which they help people in many kinds of trouble to solve their problems. Taking four cases - a pensioner, a youngster in juvenile court, an unmarried mother and a family distressed by the threat of illness and poverty - the film describes how each case is investigated, and how people in need are put in touch with available aid, both government and private.
